oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibition buildings; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Events; Fairs; Commemorations; Columns; Porticoes (Porches)
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of the Auditorium at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition, which had Colonial style architecture. It had a one-hundred and forty foot high square tower and four porticoes on the corners of the building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Calvert Bros. & Taylor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Auditorium was used to hold large meetings, events, and concerts accommodating up to six thousand people. The preliminary inaugural exercises were held in the Auditorium on June 1, 1896, where the history of Tennessee was reviewed for the previous one hundred years.
